data.title: Shannon RFC on LinkedIn: #thereisanisle
data.meta_description: We changed things up this week and took a trip to Coonagh on Sunday morning to see our award winning minis section in action! Congrats once again to all of our‚Ä¶
data.text:
#WTWAviationConf24! This years conference will build on the outstanding success of the WTW 2023 conference, which aims to bring the airline, aviation and insurance industries together to debate market trends and the breadth of risks facing the sector now and in the future, including geopolitics, safety, data, operational challenges and ESG.

The big #fail from #Delta this week isn‚Äôt only the inability to recover as quickly as the other airlines, it‚Äôs the way they have dodged responsibility. This line at #PBI took 3 hours to navigate. No one from Delta was out in front explaining what was happening or what the next steps would be. The rank & file take their cues from the top. All companies face challenging times, how leadership responds is indicative of both character & competence. #Delta failed in both areas.

As I said before, sims not always fulfill the training requirements for certain tasks such as respond to IIMC or unusual attitude recovery procedure, companies should set a real training program, based on the individual reaction to a loss of visibility or spatial desorientation for each pilot, of course it will demand more flight time which means money, specially for the IPs, examiners and evaluators who should demonstrate a higher level of proficiency on the task so they can transmit that sense of confidence to their pilots.

Sandrine Osselin : For me, La R√©union A√©rienne, is diversity. When I arrived, I had a master's degree in analytical chemistry. So, you might as well say nothing to do with aviation insurance. #aviationsafety #aviation #aerospatial
